resources.string: If you've come to the Restless Shore seeking adventure, I suspect you will get more than you bargained for.\n\nSome people will ignore what is right in front of their eyes, but we will all see, soon enough.
Greetings, traveler. Are you perchance the {playerName} I've heard about? Yes, I thought so.\n\nI'm glad you've come. The blasted Lost here have gone to war with each other, if you can believe that.
The Withered most certainly had acquired an advantage in battle, but while you were away, I learned of something new.\n\nThe Lost pirates - they are not just fighting - they are fishing as well!
The thing I've been wondering about - if the Lost here are getting this new sense of purpose, don't you think it's probably happening elsewhere as well?
You are not going to believe this, my friend, but all our work with Constable Muller may have backfired.\n\nNow, the Lost are the only threat she wants to think about.
You have dealt with threats from both the Lost and Corrupted - that is nothing less than heroic, {playerName}.\n\nEvery being in Restless Shore owes you a debt of gratitude.
I have walked the wilds of eastern Aeternum for as far back as I can remember, but it no longer seems safe.\n\nStrange things are afoot in Restless Shore, my friend. Strange things.

Now, I've seen my fair share of magic and miracle since coming to this island, but not like this.\n\nThe wildlife here in Restless Shore's fallen under some bizarre new influence from the Angry Earth.
Let's just hope Fangsnap was the only creature out there infected by this Lycanthropy.\n\nI can't even imagine if something like this became widespread.
I have some unfortunate news, my friend. I have reason to believe Fangsnap was not the only lycanthrope in Restless Shore.\n\nI have seen tracks suggesting the presence of a were-boar, as well.
I've seen no more tracks suggesting the lycanthropy spread beyond the wolf and the boar.\n\nI did see some suspicious bear tracks, however…
Everyone is so bent out-of-shape about the Shattered Mountain, I swear they are starting to imagine things.\n\nThis too shall pass, right? That's my motto, and I'm sticking to it.
Welcome to Restless Shore. I can't tell you what a relief it is to see a new face here with clear eyes.\n\nI swear, everyone in this settlement has gone mad!
I'll start redestributing all the stolen items soon.\n\nLet's hope that'll put everyone's mind at ease and stop all this nonsense they're talking.
Alright. Let's say it's true - the Lost are getting smarter.\n\nThe coastal pirates and the Withered aren't too worrisome - what would scare me is if we saw more activity at Fort Damnation.
No matter what, If the Lost to the north are also showing signs of these advanced tactics, we've got trouble.\n\nOdds are that this whole thing's being directed from the Fort.
I wish I could say I'll be resting easier with Admiral Reis destroyed, but that's just not the case.\n\nThis whole thing with the Lost…it's got me more than a little worried for the longterm.
Believe it or not, there was a time when we enjoyed relative peace on Aeternum.\n\nThese days, there are as many wars as there are people.
Ah, {playerName}! Gurkin says you've been recruited to our cause. I'm right glad to meet you.\n\nHe's going to try again to convince Muller, but meanwhile, we got work to do.
Sad to say Gurkin had less success than you did. Constable Muller's as stubborn as ever.\n\nEven bigger problem though, is now we got things really out of balance.
Let's just hope Muller's not going to back out on us.\n\nI worry it's just too easy for her to slip back into denial, and that's something we can't afford.
That which you focus on is that which you become, traveler.\n\nThis is why we must drink and be merry - happiness is the recipe for good fortune.
Well, it is happy times around here since you showed up, {playerName}. \n\nHave you heard the news from Mourningdale, though? It is truly a tragedy.
Well now, it's good to know Barkeep Brewell's still got their hands on the taps over there in Mourningdale.\n\nThey'll get through their difficults, I'm sure. Just like we did.
Be warned that the Pirates around here take no quarter. You would be wise to ally with a powerful group like I did.
Welcome to Restless Shore, Marauder. There is much to do here and I humbly seek your help.
Welcome to Restless Shore, Marauder. There is much to do here and I humbly seek your help.\n\n[ Level 39 required for Restless Shores faction missions ]
I fear you are mistaken, my genius friend. I have nothing to say to you.
Well, thank you for your concern, but I have all I need as a proud bearer of the Marauder's banner.
Ah, it is nice to finally meet you, {playerName}. You are quite notorious, you know.\n\nYour trial to become a Gladiator was such a scandal, and now you are ready to become a Ravager.

Ah, it is nice to finally meet you, {playerName}. You are quite notorious, you know.

Your trial to become a Gladiator was such a scandal, and now you are ready to become a Ravager.

[ Level 39 required for Restless Shores faction missions ]
To face the dangers of Restless Shores and not become Lost, you are a fine warrior indeed.\n\nI am privileged to call you a comrade!

To face the dangers of Restless Shores and not become Lost, you are a fine warrior indeed.

I am privileged to call you a comrade!

[ Level 39 required for Restless Shores faction missions ]
I heard about what happened with Ravager Silas. It was… regrettable.\n\nStill, I am glad it is you who is still with us, and not her.

I heard about what happened with Ravager Silas. It was… regrettable.

Still, I am glad it is you who is still with us, and not her.

[ Level 39 required for Restless Shores faction missions ]
My dear traveler, be aware. All kinds of pirates and ruffians surround our fair town.
It so inspires me to discourse with one of our own. To what do I owe this auspicious meeting?
It so inspires me to discourse with one of our own. To what do I owe this auspicious meeting?\n\n[ Level 39 required for Restless Shores faction missions ]
I know you mean well, but you Marauders are like a hammer in a sewing kit.
Did you know that I too once followed the Spark? I also used to believe in Pelznickel. However, I matured.
Indulge not, and remain vigilant. The Covenant is watching. Always
By the grace of the light, my belief has been rewarded! I had hoped for the aid of a hero, and here you are.
By the grace of the light, my belief has been rewarded! I had hoped for the aid of a hero, and here you are.\n\n[ Level 39 required for Restless Shores faction missions ]
Without the Spark to guide you, you're just another brute with a sword.
Do you suppose I could fit the book up your arse? I mean, may the light protect you.
I have a feeling I'll be seeing more of you than either of us would like.\n\nWell, come on in. Might as well get familiar with the place.
Hey hey, I'm Master Fisher O'Connor! What's new?
Not that I have any intentions of fighting you - that would be foolish.\n\nBesides, you look like an aspiring young Fisher yourself.
Hope those drowned weapons are serving you well, or at least fetched you a fine price in trading!
Rrrrr…
Rrrrr… (The alligator seems hungry and weak.)
Have we met before? \n\nI'm Santiago Salazar. Hmm, is that is my name? It's so easy to forget oneself.

string.comment: First Quest: The First Thing I Remember
string.speaker: Boatswain Salazar - Restless Shore
string.name: SantiagoSalazar

resources.string: Pardon, have we met? Sorry, my mind's a blur. Been wandering this beach for... I've forgotten how long. \n\nIt's dreadful, not remembering...
Pardon, have we met? Sorry, my mind's a blur. Been wandering this beach for... I've forgotten how long. \n\nIt's dreadful, not remembering...

string.comment: Second Quest: Footsteps on the Beach
string.speaker: Boatswain Salazar - Restless Shore
string.name: SantiagoSalazar

resources.string: Navigating my memories is like sailing at night through a thick fog. \n\nAnd now you say I was never on those ships? I feel awful for sending you to those dangerous places.

string.comment: Third Quest: The True Terror of the Seas
string.speaker: Boatswain Salazar - Restless Shore
string.name: SantiagoSalazar

resources.string: My memory slowly returns thanks to you. I now remember how I came to this cursed island. \n\nWe were merchants captured by pirates and brought here against our will!
It’s all becoming clearer now - my purpose, my past. I remember there was a mutiny on our pirate ship. \n\nWe threw Scurvyhook overboard. But somehow the bastard survived.
Have you not been told that staring into the foliage invites attacks from that which you cannot see? \n\nNo? Let this be your first warning, human.

To stare into the foliage invites attack, for the land takes advantage of hesitancy. \n\nUnder normal circumstances, we would gladly take you up on the offer of a fight, but these are not normal circumstances.

Your confusion is evident. These are dark times with our minds divided. \n\nMany in Verdant Ascent do not support visiting Edengrove to discover what has happened. They are root bound and have settled into unhealthy ways.

If we may impose upon you once more. We are well armed for our journey, but we are still lacking one important element. \n\nIt is unwise to head into the unknown without a secure source of sustenance.

Do you know what a pleasure it is to hear ourselves think? The other minds are not so loud here, away from the bustle of Eridanus. \n\nPerhaps we shall enjoy some time to ourselves before heading off to check on Edengrove.
Shh! You'll disturb the wildlife! \n\nWe must tread carefully, for we share the land with all types of creatures.

Have you noticed anything off about the wildlife in the Sunshade Plains? This place is teeming with animals! But some of them are very out of place. \n\nThey don’t belong here. Just like us, we don't belong here.

string.comment: Second Quest: A Hair's Breadth from Danger
string.speaker: Naturalist Berzs - Restless Shore
string.name: CarynBerzs

resources.string: Now that we know this area has been tampered with, we need to find out what other harm those poachers have done. \n\nI have my suspicions, but it would be good to have hard evidence.

string.comment: Third Quest: Rule of Tooth of Claw
string.speaker: Naturalist Berzs - Restless Shore
string.name: CarynBerzs

resources.string: This is terrible! Imagine, if it hadn’t been for me, they would still be doing this. \n\nEven so, I was too late. I wasn't able to stop them. Those poor wolves…
Have you seen that roguish treasure hunter, Xue? Doesn't he cut a dashing figure? \n\nI wish I knew what treasure he was searching for so I could give it to him.

string.comment: First Quest: Steadfast as the Sea
string.speaker: Wader Keles - Restless Shore
string.name: WafaKeles

resources.string: Have you seen that handsome treasure hunter, Xue? He's such a scoundrel. And I find that irresistible. \n\nIf only I was half as confident! I’d court him in a heartbeat!
You’ve inspired me! I’m going to offer Xue my services as an aquatic treasure hunter. \n\nI still want to give him Poseidon’s Goblet, but I don’t want to make it seem like a bribe.
I’m so nervous! Do you think Xue will agree to being partners? \n\nI just don’t know what to say when he's around. What if he thinks I’m foolish?
Why hello! What brings you to my stretch of beach? \n\nThere's a wealth of treasure to be found here, if you know where to look.

string.comment: First Quest: Not Another Fish in the Sea
string.speaker: Rogue Xue - Restless Shore
string.name: XueTian

resources.string: Give me predictable terrors any day over the unknown. The pirates on the beach have their habits. Even the alligators have their set ways. \n\nBut the fickle sea? It strikes without warning, taking everything from you.
Are my clothes clean? Is my hair tidy? \n\nI want to make sure I make a good impression when I meet with Wafa.
